meanings.sent1: The noncredit class was informative but did not count towards my degree.
meanings.sent2: She took a noncredit course to learn a new skill without affecting her GPA.
meanings.sent3: The noncredit workshop on gardening was so fun, I forgot I wasn't getting credit for it!
meanings.sent4: His noncredit status in the class made him feel like a silent observer, rather than an active participant.
meanings.sent5: The noncredit option allowed students to explore various subjects without the pressure of grades.

meanings.definition: A course that does not count towards a degree.
meanings.sent1: I decided to take a noncredit in photography to improve my skills.
meanings.sent2: The noncredit was a great way to learn something new without the stress of exams.
meanings.sent3: The noncredit in cooking turned out to be a delicious adventure!
meanings.sent4: Her noncredit in art was like a blank canvas waiting to be filled with creativity.
meanings.sent5: The noncredit provided a flexible option for students to explore diverse interests.
